name: Holiday Inn Express Belfast City Queens Quarter

reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located for visiting Belfast, particularly the university quarter and the Botanic Gardens with the added benefit of having free parking on site. We took a taxi to the centre which worked out cheaper than driving in and parking.
reviews.title: Ideal for overnight stay

likes.disliked: — Drinks not being served in the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were as expected from a Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Good Value; Good Location.

likes.disliked: — Nothing - good value for the money.

reviews.text: Rotten hotel, car park out the back makes you feel like you
reviews.title: Horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: are entering a prison. My bedroom was rank but bathroom was clean.
reviews.title: Paper Thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the upside the girl at reception was OK and buffet breakfast was very good, these were the only upsides to a very ordinary hotel.
reviews.title: Very very bad value for my money

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and tidy and is in a good location for visiting Belfast.
reviews.title: an appaling experience

likes.liked: — some decent pubs five mins away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on the first day was good, but it was not that busy. On the second day it was much busier and breakfast was poor, lots of dirty tables, poor quality sausages, no glasses for the fruit juice and the toaster not working properly
reviews.title: Had a good time!

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel earlier this year on business. First of all location, its ok but the first thing I saw when walking out of the hotel lobby was a beggar being threatened by a gang. Thankfully they left him alone, admittedly the hotel has no control of this but it gives you an idea of what the area is like.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second the hotel, its old, tired and needs renovation.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: However secure parking is good and the staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Visiting friends and relations in Belfast

reviews.text: Other hotels in Belfast are better.
reviews.title: not a bad place

reviews.text: Nice hotel in Belfast. Clean and spacious rooms, situated in a calm place and only 15 minutes walk from the City Centre. Got some really nice tips on where to eat and have a pint of Guinness from the receptionist, also.
reviews.title: Overall good choice

aka: Holiday Inn Express Belfast City Queens Quarter Hotel Belfast
description: In the centre of Belfast's lively University Quarter, the 3 star Express by Holiday Inn hotel is perfect for the value conscious traveler within 2 minutes of the many restaurants, bars & cafes of popular Botanic Ave & within walking distance of the historic Queens University. The main shopping & business areas are within walking distance as is the major tourist attractions including the Ulster Museum & Belfasts Botanical Gardens. The hotel offers extremely competitive rates, Complimentary car parking, Complimentary Wi-Fi in all public areas & Complimentary traditional cooked buffet breakfast which is served in the comfort of the Great room by our friendly staff from 7am for those early risers. The en-suite bedrooms are attractively designed & have cable TV, modem points, High Speed Wireless Internet at a charge, power showers, hairdryers, tea & coffee facilities, telephones & in room movies. There are six well equipped meeting rooms all located on the ground floor, seating up to 120 people. There is a bar & restaurant serving good food at sensible prices. Express by Holiday Inn benefits from excellent transport links, Great Victoria St bus & railway station is within 5 minutes whilst the M1 & M2 motorways are also within short proximity. The hotel is a short taxi ride from the George Best City Airport & the International Airport & Ferry Terminals.
